messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] when in doubt
messages.msgSnippet: Not sure...it is actually possible I ve got my lists mixed up.  It s happened before.  But I just put it together that you also homeschool ... can you say
messages.messageBody:
Not sure...it is actually possible I've got my lists mixed up. It's
happened before. But I just put it together that you also homeschool ...
can you say 'well, duh!'? <LOL>

Eiraul

Brownville77@...

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] when in doubt
messages.msgSnippet: If I didn t do anything I had doubts about, I wouldn t do anything at all. Eileen ... __________________________________________________ Do You Yahoo!? Yahoo!
messages.messageBody:
If I didn't do anything I had doubts about, I wouldn't
do anything at all.

Eileen


--- Jon and Rue Kream <skreams@...> wrote:
> I once heard it put really well, but I can't
> remember how it was said.
> Something like "doubt means don't". I try to always

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] when in doubt
messages.msgSnippet: I once heard it put really well, but I can t remember how it was said. Something like doubt means don t .  I try to always listen to the tiny nagging voice,
messages.messageBody:
I once heard it put really well, but I can't remember how it was said.
Something like "doubt means don't". I try to always listen to the tiny
nagging voice, and usually later think, oh, THAT's why it wouldn't have been
good for me. ~Rue

-----Original Message-----
From: Dennis/Laurie Brown [mailto:Brownville77@...]
Sent: Tuesday, May 08, 2001 5:58 PM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] when in doubt


I like the following quote and thought it could use being re-said!
Something most of us should probably consider at one time or another...I
know I'd have saved myself grief more than once if I had remembered this in
time.
Oh well. Live and learn.

Eiraul

Brownville77@...
